title: gallagher_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
Playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. A security officer of the Bloodhound Family at Penacony, as well as a History Fictionologist. Voiced by Mikami Satoshi in Japanese. 

He is portrayed with a [[muscular male|muscular]] build, [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[brown hair]], [[facial hair]], and [[red eyes]]. His outfit consists of a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[black shirt]], black [[chest belt]], [[pink necktie]], [[white vest]], [[black belt]], [[purple pants]], mismatched gloves ([[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] on his right, [[white gloves|white]] on his left), [[bandaged arm|bandages]] on his right arm, and [[black footwear|black shoes]]. 

h4. Profile
[expand]
"Making a drink is a sensory skill. In dreams, creating fizzy concoctions requires adding a bit of your mood. Heavier if you're troubled, a touch sweeter if you're in high spirits... It's not just about mixing beverages. It's about mixing the experiences of life."

A security officer of the Bloodhound Family at Penacony. He is also a slovenly and indolent mixologist. Though unorganized in apparel and casual in how he makes his drinks, he is always courteous toward guests but keeps his vigilance about him.

He seems to be a character with a complicated past, yet never actively mentions any details.
[/expand]

h4. Appearance

* !post #7691355: Splash art
other_names: ギャラガー(スターレイル)

title: kicchou_yachie
body: Matriarch of the Kiketsu Family The fourth stage boss of [[Touhou]] 17: [[Wily Beast and Weakest Creature]]. She is a [[turtle shell|turtle]]-[[dragon girl|dragon]] creature, a Jidiao or Kicchou (吉弔), with [[short hair|short]], [[blonde hair]], [[red eyes]], a prominent [[dragon tail]], and a pair of [[antlers]]. She wears a [[blue_shirt|blue shirt]] with a [[blue skirt]] and a pair of [[mary janes]]. Her eyes are [[yellow eyes|yellow]] in [[Unfinished Dream of All Living Ghost]] Yachie is a manipulative leader whose ability nullifies her opponents will to fight back. Her Kiketsu Family specializes in surprise attacks. She and her organization are responsible for luring the protagonist to the Animal Realm, as part of a staged invasion with the other organizations. She's the leader of the [[otter_spirit_(touhou)|Otter spirits]]. h4. See also * [[Kicchou Yachie (Jidiao)]] h4. External Links * "Touhou Wiki: Yachie Kicchou":https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Yachie_Kicchou

title: i_need_more_bullets_(meme)
body: [b]I Need More Bullets[/b], also known as [b]I Need More Boolets[/b] or [b]I Need More Boullets[/b], refers to a series of viral [[TikTok]] videos showing a [[npc streaming (meme)|NPC Streamer]] named R.octavoc.r ("@isrhaul":[https://www.tiktok.com/@isrhaul]) playing the part of a French soldier on [[TikTok LIVE]], telling the camera that he needs more bullets while also [[ass shake|shaking his butt]], similar to twerking. He also said other catchphrases like "[[terminator (series)|Hasta la vista baby!]]" The TikToker's content was ultimately made for a gay audience. Screen-recordings of his livestreams began to go viral in mid-2023, leading to memes that used his videos, predominantly starting in August 2023.

title: datenshi-chan_(nanawo_akari)
body:
An original character designed by [[Terada Tera]] for the music video of [[Nanawo Akari]]'s similarly named song, "Dadadada Tenshi", written by [[NayutalieN]] (see post #2826318). She is in her own words a "no good" [[angel]]. Since the release of "Dadadada Tenshi" she has been featured in other music videos such as "Instant Heaven", "Kanzen Houki Sengen", "One Room Sugar Life", "Meltic Hell", etc and has become a mascot for the singer & songwriter.

She has [[white wings|white]] [[feathered wings|feathered]] [[angel wings| angel]] [[wings]] that [[low wings| originate from her lower back]]. Her hair is [[pink hair|pink]] and she wears it [[hair up|done up]] in [[double bun]]s with [[sidelocks]] and her [[bangs]] [[hair between eyes|between her eyes]],  and [[hair ornament|decorates it]] with a [[purple bow|purple]] [[hair bow]] under each bun, and her "[[halo]]" (which is actually a "circline ":[https://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/circline] [[fluorescent lamp]] bulb with a [[pull cord]]) around her right hair bun. Her eyes are also [[pink eyes|pink]], often depicted as being [[narrowed eyes|narrowed]], [[jitome]], and/or [[upturned eyes|upturned]] with [[constricted pupils]] in [[Terada Tera (style)|Terada Tera's distinctive art style]]. She typically wears a [[pink sweater|pink]] [[off-shoulder sweater|off-shoulder]] [[sweater]] that shows her [[bare shoulders]], a [[grey skirt|grey]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[skirt]], and a [[purple bowtie]].

title: hide_(singer)
body:
Hide (Matsumoto Hideto) was the lead guitarist of X Japan, a pioneering Japanese rock band.
Known for his vibrant style and unique guitar skills, he helped shape Japan's visual-kei movement.
Hide also had a successful solo career, influencing many in Japan's rock scene.
He passed away in 1998, leaving a lasting legacy in music.

title: kenmun
body: Kenmun are hairy water and tree spirits from the Amami islands in southern Japan. They look like a cross between a kappa and a monkey. They also closely resemble their Okinawan cousins, kijimunā. Their bodies are covered in dark red or black hair, and they have long, thin legs and arms. They are slightly larger in size than a human child. They have pointed mouths, and on top of their heads is a saucer-like depression which holds a small amount of oil or water. Their bodies smell like yams, and their drool smells terrible.

title: dragon_quest_v
body:
[i]Dragon Quest V[/i] (subtitled "Hand of the Heavenly Bride" in English) is the fifth installment in the [i][[Dragon Quest]][/i] video game series.  The game is noteworthy as the first 16-bit installment of the series, and for its central conceit of following the [[Hero (DQ5)|main character]] from childhood to maturity, seeing how the world and other characters change as he ages.  The player must also famously make a marriage decision between two (or, in some versions, three) different girls who will offer themselves to the hero, one of whom will eventually become the mother of his children.
 
Originally developed by Chunsoft and published by Enix Corporation, Dragon Quest V was released for the [[Super Famicom]]. It has since been remade for the [[PlayStation 2]] and [[Nintendo DS]].  Only the DS version has been officially released in English.

title: virtual_youtuber
body:
A [b]Virtual YouTuber[/b], sometimes called [b]VTuber[/b], is a content creator and personality that utilizes a 3D or 2D digital avatar for online videos and/or [[livestream]]ing, often assuming a character as well. Despite the name, content is not limited to [[YouTube]], and often, a VTuber is someone who declares themselves as such.

The term was first popularized by [[Kizuna Ai]], who called herself "the world's first virtual YouTuber". Many others followed suit, and the explosion in popularity of the practice lead the term to be used even outside of [[YouTube]], though variations on the term have been introduced as to diminish the use of the brand name, including "VTuber", "Virtual Singer"/"VSinger" (for those that exclusively do music, not be confused with [[VSinger (Vocaloid)|Vocaloid China]]), and "Virtual Liver"/"VLiver" (specifically referring to virtual streamers) or "Virtual Streamer"/"VStreamer" (due to the former term reminding folks of the organ in English). In Chinese, the term "Virtual Uploader"/"VUP" is used more commonly alongside "VTuber", after being first coined by [[Xiao Xi]] on [[Bilibili]]. In English, terms such as "PNGTuber" and "GIFTuber" also exist to refer to VTubers whose models use those formats, now that they are no longer the norm among indies (that had no access to 3D models back in the day). In Japan, the term "VLiver" is also used to refer creators and companies in the 'walled garden app' niche, such as [[IRIAM]] and [[AniLive]], apps which viewers use to watch VTubers who stream exclusively on them.

This tag should apply to not only virtual YouTubers themselves, but also to [[parody|parodies]] of virtual YouTubers, references to them, fictitious virtual YouTubers, fake virtual YouTubers, and concept art that ultimately isn't used (for the latter three, [code]original[/code] should be used). While tagging mascots and staff with the tag is fine, family members and friends of VTubers don't apply, unless they too are VTubers, nor do things merely associated with VTubers.

h4. See also 

* [[Indie Virtual YouTuber]] (for use with solo indies)
* [[List of virtual YouTubers]]
* [[utaite]]

* Moegirl article (Chinese): "Virtual Uploader":https://zh.moegirl.org/zh-hans/%E8%99%9A%E6%8B%9FUP%E4%B8%BB

title: dracula_(castlevania)
body:
A prominent antagonist in the [[Castlevania (series)|]] video game series, there known as Vlad Țepeș Dracula. In this series, his appearance has shifted between entries, though he usually retains a gentlemanly air. However, his demonic transformations run a wide gauntlet. His son is Adrian Fahrenheit Țepeș (who is most often seen going by the name "[[Alucard (Castlevania)|Alucard]]", Dracula backwards, in defiance of his evil father), and his main confidant and right-hand is [[Death (Castlevania)|Death]] (the Grim Reaper).

h4. See Also

* [[Dracula]]

title: commander_(sonic)
body:
The leader of the Guardian Units of Nations (GUN), a [[military]] faction in the [[Sonic (series)|]] series. He has [[grey hair]] and [[heterochromia|heterochromatic]] [[brown eyes|brown]] and [[green eyes]].

Having stayed on the [[space_colony_ark|ARK]] along with [[maria_robotnik|Maria]], he developed a great resentment against [[shadow_the_hedgehog|Shadow]], blaming him for the killing of both her and the other people aboard the space colony. 
The franchise's run with [[sonic_the_hedgehog_(archie_comics)|Archie Comics]] and the [[Sonic X Shadow Generations]]: Dark Beginnings animation give him the name "Abraham Tower".

title: dove
body:
For tagging purposes, this tag refers to the white or mostly white birds, such as the "dove of peace" that is commonly associated with the term "dove." 

The term dove is frequently used interchangeably with the term pigeon.  When used more specifically, the term refers to smaller members of the bird family Columbidae, whose members are referred to by either the terms dove or pigeon. Members of this family fall under two major groups based on their diet, with one group predominately eating seeds and the other predominately eating fruits.

Gray or bluish-gray birds should be tagged [[pigeon]] instead.

[[common emerald dove]]

body: Based on [[Beetlejuice|Tim Burton’s dearly beloved film]], BEETLEJUICE tells the story of [[Lydia Deetz]], a strange and unusual teenager whose whole life changes when she meets a recently deceased couple and a demon with a thing for stripes.

title: beetlejuice_(cartoon)
body: Beetlejuice is an animated television series that ran from 1989 to 1991, based on the first [[Beetlejuice]] film released in 1988. The animated show centers around the characters Beetlejuice and [[lydia_deetz|Lydia]], from the first film. It also includes the recurring characters Delia Deetz and Charles Deetz from the film. Oddly, neither Adam Maitland nor Barbara Maitland appear in the animated series, though the bridge where they died is shown.

title: nurse_robot_type_t
body:
[b]Nurse Robot Type T[/b] (Stylized as [b]NurseRobot_TypeT[/b]) is an original character designed and voiced by artist [[SuteinuA]] (a.k.a. Matsuo Kayu). She received [[UTAU]], [[COEIROINK]], [[CoeFont]] and [[VOICEVOX]] voicebanks. She has several nicknames: TT (from her full name), the Little Nurse (小护士), and Taotie (饕餮).

TT has [[blonde hair]], [[orange eyes]], [[short hair]] with both [[side braids]]. As her name, she is a nurse wearing [[nurse cap]], white [[sleeveless dress]] and golves with white back and black front. Sometimes she wears [[lab coat]], or takes a pair of huge [[tank_(container)|tanks]]. Her obviously [[mechanical legs]] showing she is an [[android]].

A notable change of TT's character design is that new red [i][[shamrock]][/i] (or [i][[four-leaf clover]][/i]) mark on her nurse cap had replaced [[red cross]] in old design.
h4. External Link

title: size_difference
body:
An image that focuses heavily on the size difference between two or more people; often [[minigirl]], [[miniboy]], [[giantess]], and [[giant male]] pictures fall into this category.

If the 'natural' difference in size between characters, ie. 'short' vs 'tall' is the focus of the picture, use [[height difference]] instead. If one person has a small body overall, they are [[petite]].

Focusing exclusively on breast, penis, or muscle size difference is respectively [[breast envy]], [[penis size difference]], and [[muscle envy]] instead.

For an image that has been changed from its original size, use [[resized]].

h4. See also

* [[age difference]]
* [[height difference]]
* [[koonago]]
* [[muscular uke]]

title: yakul
body:
A large antelope-like fictional animal originating from the [[shuna_no_tabi|The Journey of Shuna]] and again in [[mononoke_hime|Princess Mononoke]].  Used as a mount by protagonists [[Shuna_(snt)|]] and [[Ashitaka]] in their respective series.

Yakul is stated to be a now extinct species of giant [[serow]] called an [i]Akashishi[/i] (アカシシ), though features horns similar to a Lechwe [[antelope]].  The name has been translated in English as [i]Red Elk[/i], though in other languages has been referred to things such as an [[ibex_(animal)|]].

body:

title: moose
body:
The largest species of [[deer]] with large open-hand shaped [[antlers]] found in Northern Europe, Asia, and North America.

Also known as an "elk" in UK English, but the term in English began to simply refer to large deer in general by the 17th century due to moose having been long extinct on the British Isles.  North American colonists eventually started calling [i]Cervus canadensis[/i], a deer species native to North American and the second largest deer species in general, by the term "elk."

h4. See also

* "Wikipedia: Moose":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moose]

body:

The group is known for its experimental and existentialist approach in its songs, addressing themes such as spirituality, philosophy and social criticism.

title: ground_pound
body:
A move that has had as much impact on the [[Mario (series)|Mario]] franchise as moves such as the Wall Jump and Spin Jump. This move is usually executed by crouching in mid-air, but is sometimes performed by pressing the jump button twice instead (usually in [[Mario Party]] minigames). When used, the character will smash their butt on the ground, which can have many results.

This move can break or activate blocks from above, in contrast to the effect of a normal jump. It is sometimes the only way to defeat an enemy or complete a mission, such as destroying [[Chain Chomp]]s' stakes in the [[New Super Mario Bros.]] series, and is usually more powerful than a normal stomp.

Not to be confused with [[ground and pound]]

h4. External links
* "Super Mario Wiki":https://www.mariowiki.com/Ground_Pound#Names_in_other_languages

They have green or green-blue eyes and sharp facial features and a lean to muscular build.

title: omegaverse
body:
A sexual setting loosely based on wolf behavior, commonly associated with [[yaoi]] stories.
 Humans are split into one of three biological categories: Alpha (Dominant species, may have actual wolf biology), Beta (Subservient species, humans as we know them) and Omega (Lowest rung, both genders are capable of getting pregnant and can go into heat).

While this setting originated in fanfiction, it has expanded to other mediums like visual novels and manga.

title: sarashi
body:
A long, winding strip of cloth, usually thick cotton, wrapped tightly around the midriff up to the chest. Historically, samurai wore them under their kimono to resist injury.

In anime series, particularly in classic older ones, a delinquent character will be seen wearing one under their coat or unbuttoned shirt. The wrapping was a visible cue as to their general level of bad-assery.  In this form the sarashi is wound mostly around the abdomen.

Alternatively, a tomboyish girl may wear one to bind and/or flatten her breasts, especially if she is trying to pass as male.  This gradually evolved into what is nowadays the more common way of wearing a sarashi, which is in the style of a [[tube top]]; in this case, it wraps around only the chest area in a very nontraditional way, leaving the [[midriff]] bare (e.g. post #4296298, post #4076845, post #3616420, post #2644312). This sarashi style is especially seen on kendo girls and other fighters.

h4. Specific sarashi tags

* !post #6544025: [[Midriff sarashi]]
* !post #4185079: [[Chest sarashi]]
* !post #3845880: [[Midriff sarashi]] + [[Chest sarashi]]
* !post #2969475: [[Budget sarashi]]
* [[Undone sarashi]] - if the sarashi is unwrapped

h4. See also

* [[chest binder]]

title: king_george_v_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the lead ship and name ship of the [i]King George V[/i]-class battleships of the [[Royal Navy]]. 
Character design by [[Enka (bcat)|]], voiced by [[Kawasumi Ayako]].

h4. Appearance
[tn]See post #3515601.[/tn]

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] and [[red eyes]], with [[large breasts]].

Her default outfit, fittingly enough, is royal in theme and consisting of a [[red cape|red]] [[fur trim]] [[cape]], [[red jacket]] with [[epaulettes]] and sleeve rank for captains, [[medal]]s, a [[double-breasted]] [[white shirt]], [[white skirt|white]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black thighhighs]] with [[garter straps]], black [[knee boots]], [[blue ribbon|blue]] [[hair ribbon]], and a [[saber (weapon)|]] as her melee weapon (which also doubles as a seiyuu connection with [[Saber (fate)|another one of Kawasumi's roles]]).

Her [[rigging]] consists of her two real-life 356 mm quad main gun mounts attached to a funnel-and-mast piece behind her, and two hull pieces containing her third 356 mm twin mount on her left and two 13.3 cm twin [[anti-aircraft gun|DP mounts]] on her right.

title: shadaloo_dolls
body:
The [b]Shadaloo Dolls[/b], or just the [b]Dolls[/b] for short, are a group of [[M. Bison]]'s [[mind control|brainwashed]] female underlings first introduced in [[Street Fighter Zero (series)|Street Fighter Zero III]], who serve as the co-sub-bosses in said game.

The initial twelve "Dolls" were young girls that Shadaloo has kidnapped from around the world to be brainwashed and re-conditioned as a specialist unit within the Shadaloo syndicate, with each named after the different months in their respective native tongue. The final Doll, [[Cammy White]], was specifically created from Bison's DNA and was to be a potential body replacement until she went rouge by the time of [[Street Fighter II (series)|]].

The Dolls can be distinguished by their uniform consisting of a [[striped clothes|striped]] [[blue leotard|dark blue]] [[leotard]] worn over a [[black pantyhose]], a [[beret]], [[red gloves]], [[yellow necktie]], and a [[boots]]. The exception of this is Cammy, who instead wear a light blue [[highleg leotard|highleg]], [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] leotard without a pantyhose, [[yellow gloves]], and a boots.

This tag cover posts featuring characters wearing an outfit based on the Dolls, which may vary in color aside from canonical source. If the said leotard is based on a particular unique design (such as Cammy's), then the [[cosplay]] tag is applicable.

h4. Members

title: firefly_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A playable character from [[Honkai: Star Rail]].

Known as Hotaru ("Firefly") in Japanese. Not to be confused with [[Lumine_(Genshin_Impact)|Lumine]] from [[Genshin Impact]], whose Japanese name is also Hotaru. Voiced by [[Kusunoki Tomori]] in Japanese. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] with a light [[green hair|green]] [[gradient hair|gradient end]], [[two-tone eyes|two-tone]] [[blue eyes|blue]]-[[purple eyes]], and [[medium breasts|medium]] (sometimes [[large breasts|large]] in fanart) breasts. Her default outfit consists of a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white shirt]]/[[white dress|dress]] with an inner layer [[green dress]], [[orange neckerchief]], [[black hairband]], [[black thighhighs]], [[black footwear|black]] [[ankle boots]], and a single [[bridal gauntlets|bridal gauntlet]] on her left arm. 

h4. Profile
[expand]
"Fireflies are such magical creatures, aren't they? They may throw themselves at a flame or suddenly grow old, but every night before that, they will shine brighter than the stars."

Member of the Stellaron Hunters, a young girl clad in the mechanical armor "[[sam (honkai: star rail)|SAM]]."

title: morrigan_aensland
body:
[b]Morrigan Aensland[/b] ([b]モリガン・アーンスランド[/b]) is the de facto main character from the [[Darkstalkers]] series of fighting games.

Morrigan is a [[demon girl|succubus]] who is very vain and lives for little more than the excitement of battle. She appears as a beautiful woman with [[long hair|long]], light [[green hair]], [[large breasts]] and [[bat wings|bat-like wings]] on her back and on the [[head wings|sides of her head]], artwork tends to depict her with either [[green eyes|green]] or [[yellow eyes|yellow]] eyes. Morrigan can reshape these wings into spikes and blades when attacking her enemies, as well as using them to shield herself from enemy attacks. Her [[wings]] can also separate from her, and form into a cloud of bats. She uses a variety of magical attacks as well. Her standard outfit reveals a large amount of [[cleavage]] and [[heart cutout]] on her [[leotard]].

Originally planned to be a vampire in her debut, Morrigan's appearance made way for the popular depiction of succubi in Japanese media.
other_names: モリガン・アーンスランド

Since then, he reappeared in the followup to New Generation Heroes, [[Ultra Galaxy Fight: The Absolute Conspiracy]] where he plays a prominent role in the first and third parts of the miniseries, [[Ultra Galaxy Fight: The Destined Crossroad]] and [[Ultraman Trigger (series)|Ultraman Trigger: New Generation Tiga]], where he co-stars as a returning Ultra as part of a 2-part crossover with The Destined Crossroad (as well as heading up the concurrent "voice drama":[https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLwDaeL3aOb-z8gVFaB8awOotibdCCzbe8]).

A [[fox girl]] with [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] and [[yellow eyes]]. She has orange [[fox ears]] and [[fox tail]] with white [[animal ear fluff|fluff]], like that of an American red fox.

Her official outfit consists of a [[pink shirt|pink]] [[off shoulder]] [[crop top]] with a [[zipper]] on the front, and a [[striped camisole]] [[undershirt|underneath]], both of which reveal her [[midriff]] and [[cleavage]], as well as [[highleg panties]] under her [[shorts]]. Notably, she features a [[star hair ornament]] and [[choker]].

Debuted on [[twitch.tv|Twitch]] February 22, 2021, but has been active on Pixiv since late 2018.

Gained added notability as she was commissioned by [[vedal987]] to be the artist and designer for [[Neuro-Sama]]'s second model. She has subsequently gone and done the design for Neuro's "sister" [[Evil Neuro-sama]].  Since then she has become a regular collaborator in Neuro's streams, where she has embraced being Neuro's "mom", and tones down her ecchiness during such collabs tremendously, to the point where her most often used outfit is a very form-concealing (but still cute) hoodie.

title: help:post_relationships
body:
h4. Parent and Child Posts

Parent and child posts, also known as [b]Post Relationships[/b], are a means of linking together groups of related posts. One post (normally the "best" version) is chosen to be the parent, while the other posts are made its children.

Parent/child relationships are typically used to group minor variants of the same image. Pools are another way of grouping posts; see the guidelines below for when to use a pool instead.

h6. Browsing

When viewing a post in a parent/child relationship, the other posts in the relationship are displayed as thumbnails at the top of the page. In search listings, parent posts are displayed with a green border, while child posts have a yellow border.

h6. Searching

Parent/child relationships may be searched using the {{parent:ID}}, {{parent:any}}, {{parent:none}}, {{child:any}}, or {{child:none}} metatags (see [[help:cheatsheet]]).

h6. Adding a parent

First, note the parent post's ID number. This is located under the [b]Information[/b] sidebar when viewing a post, or as part of the URL (e.g. /posts/1234).

Next, open the child post and click the [b]Edit[/b] link just below the image. Enter the post ID of the parent post in the [b]Parent[/b] field, then click [b]Submit[/b] to save your changes. Repeat this process for all child posts in the relationship.

You may also tag the post with the {{parent:ID}} or {{child:ID}} metatag, where ID is the post's ID number. This method can be used with [[help:tag scripts|tag scripts]] to quickly parent multiple posts.

h6. Removing a parent

Open the child post and click the [b]Edit[/b] link just below the image. Clear the [b]Parent[/b] field, then click [b]Submit[/b] to save your changes. Repeat for all other child posts in the relationship as necessary.

You may also tag the post with {{parent:none}} or {{-parent:ID}} to remove the parent.

To clear the same parent post from multiple children at once, tag the post with {{child:none}}.

h4. Guidelines

Generally, parent/child relationships should be used for minor variations of the same image. For comics or other series of posts meant to be viewed in order, use a [[help:pools|Pool]] instead.

h6. When TO use Post relationships

* When the same image is available in multiple resolutions or pixel sizes (see post #716608).
* When cropped and whole versions of the same image has been uploaded (see post #1540326)
* Derivatives of a Post, including setting variations (post #1544682) and costume variations (post #154471). See also post #625848 (hard translation and derivative character art) and post #55525 (smaller post and [[vector trace]]).
* When identical images from different sources have been uploaded. For which posts to set parent and child, see below.

h6. When NOT to use Post Relationships

For most other cases, it would be better to organize these images into a ([[help:pools|Pool]]). Examples include:

* Pages from a manga or doujin.
* Episodes of a comic.
* Any other series of posts intended to be viewed in order.
* Large collections of posts.

In such cases, Pools provide additional navigation features not available with Post Relationships.

h4. Choosing the Best Parent

The Parent Post should be considered in this order:

h6. For identical images

* [b]Most recent [u]active[/u] revision[/b]. There are exceptional cases where the latest revision is worse (ie, much smaller resolution, unless both are already [[absurdres]]) than the previous image (post #2645830). See [[MD5 mismatch]], [[revision]], and [[has bad revision]].
* [b]Highest resolution[/b]. If a picture has been [[upscaled]], the upscaled version should be the child.
* [b]Uncensored[/b]. Official [[uncensored]] versions (not to be confused with nude or third-party [[decensored]] versions) should be the parent, while censored ones should be children.
* [b]Highest quality[/b] (see [[jpeg_artifacts]], [[scan_artifacts]]). Prefer images with fewer artifacts. Larger filesize tends to mean higher quality, but not always.
* [b]Most lossless file format[/b] (png > jpg). See also [[lossy-lossless]], in the case a png is more lossy than its most original jpeg counterpart.
* [b]Most unaltered metadata[/b] for exactly identical images.
** In late 2020 Pixiv stripped metadata from [b]all[/b] of their pictures and recompressed most of them, so this line does not apply anymore to them - if the filesize is very close, they're often identical to the twitter equivalent and should not be uploaded if an already existing version with similar filesize is present onsite
** In fairly unique cases, the artist will have metadata present in an image from another site that needs to be manually checked.

* [b][[Image sample]]s[/b] should always be parented to their original image (and subsequently flagged and/or deleted).
* [b][[Duplicate]]s[/b] should be set as children of already existing posts when all the above criteria are identical in both pictures.
* Banned [b][[paid reward]]s[/b] should be set as the children of the lower-quality image, assuming it is on Danbooru.

h6. For derivative posts

* [b]Most original[/b], as opposed to confirmed derivatives.
* [b]Most exploitable[/b] variation of the post for creating derivatives.
* [b]Most complete[/b], as opposed to cropped posts.
* [b]Cleanest[/b], containing the least watermarking. In the case of third party [[detexted]] versions, the detexted one should be the child.

There might be exceptions with the above, for example if a picture is much higher resolution than its counterpart. If you are unsure which version should be the Parent, leave a comment on that Post or ask in the Forum.

h4. See also

* [[Help:Pools]]

title: vlad_iii_dracula
body:
Vlad III, Prince of Wallachia (1431–1476/77), was a member of the House of Drăculești, a branch of the House of Basarab, also known, using his patronymic, as Vlad Drăculea or Vlad Dracula (Old Church Slavonic: Владъ Дрьколъ). He was posthumously dubbed Vlad the Impaler (modern Romanian: Vlad Țepeș, pronounced [ˈvlad ˈt͡sepeʃ]) due to his habit of impaling his enemy's corpses. He is well known for his resistance against the [[Ottoman Empire]].

The name of the vampire Count [[Dracula]] in Bram Stoker's 1897 novel [i]Dracula[/i] was derived from William Wilkinson's book [i]An Account of the Principalities of Wallachia and Moldavia[/i], where he makes reference to both Vlad III and his father, Vlad II Dracul, as "Voïvode Dracula", with Stoker copying in his notes the footnote on the name, where it revealed its meaning of 'devil', and that it was given "as a surname to any person who rendered himself conspicuous either by courage, cruel actions, or cunning." This has inspired later authors, prior to Stoker's own notes becoming public, to associate the historical Vlad III with the vampire Count Dracula, with several Dracula-based fictions (e.g. [[Castlevania (series)|]] series, [[Hellsing]], etc.) regarding them as the same person, despite the original novel itself dismissing the association after introducing it later on.

h4.See also

* [[vlad_tepes_(eiyuu_senki)|Vlad Tepes]] ([[Eiyuu Senki]])
* [[vlad tepes (hellsing)|Vlad Tepes]] ([[Hellsing]])
* [[Vlad III (Fate/Apocrypha)]]
* [[Vlad III (Fate/Extra)]]
* [[vlad_iii_(moeoh_ex)|Vlad III (Moeoh EX)]]
* [[Tag Group:People]]

title: gokuhara_gonta
body:
[i][[Danganronpa V3: Killing Harmony]][/i] character.

The Ultimate Entomologist. As a child, he had gotten lost in the woods and stayed there ever since, being raised instead by the creatures of the forest. His love of bugs comes from the time he spent with them in the woods, and he hates those who think lowly of them. Because he had been disconnected from civilization for so long until high school, he is trying to keep up and make himself a perfect gentleman.

He is [[dark-skinned male|a big man with dark skin]] and [[long hair|long]] [[green hair]]. His [[school uniform]] consists of a matching brown [[blazer]] and pants, over which he slings an [[insect cage]] over. Has [[red eyes]] and [[round eyewear|round]] [[glasses]]. Due to his forest upbringing, he tends to go [[barefoot]].

title: daxiushan
body: Daxiushan, also referred as dianchailiyi, dashan or daxiu is a traditional Chinese upper garment, with broad long sleeves in Hanfu. It was most popular during the Tang dynasty, particularly among the members of royalty. it looks like a thin fabric [[cardigan]], without any closure. title: victor_van_dort_spraying_raid_and_screaming_(meme)
body:
[b]Victor Van Dort Spraying Raid and Screaming[/b] refers to a series of fan art redraws depicting characters from various fandoms spraying a can of Raid ant and roach killer towards the viewer while [[screaming]]. The redraws are based on a screenshot from a Maya Winky ASMR [[YouTube]] video where she cosplays as [[Victor Van Dort]] from [[Corpse Bride]] and were popularized on X, formerly [[Twitter]], in November 2023, spreading to sites like [[Tumblr]] that month.
h4. External links
* "KnowYourMeme: Victor Van Dort Spraying Raid and Screaming":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/victor-van-dort-spraying-raid-and-screaming]

title: taiga_drama
body:
[[nhk (broadcaster)|NHK]]'s Sunday night program slot for year-long [[jidaigeki]] series.

Launched in the early days of Japanese television with the aim of creating Japan's best entertainment jidaigeki to rival movies, each Taiga Drama series is a big-budget production starring many big-name actors, considered the most prestigious among Japanese dramas. Running for around 50 episodes, each series usually focuses on one historical figure and depicts the era in depth through the life of that person, much like a roman-fleuve (thus [i]taiga[/i], which means "river" and so as "fleuve" in French).

h4. See also

* [[Dousuru Ieyasu]]
* [[Kamakura-dono no 13-nin]]
* [[Sanada Maru]]
* [[Taira no Kiyomori]]
* [[Yae no Sakura]]

title: sakurauchi_riko
body:
A protagonist in [[Love Live! Sunshine!!]]. Riko is reserved, modest, and likes indoor activities, but often flies into a panic. She plays piano, collects manga (mostly yuri specializing in [[kabedon]] and [[hand on another's chin|kabekui]]) and lives with her [[sakurauchi riko's mother|mother]].

Riko is a member of the Aqours sub-unit [[guilty kiss (love live!)|Guilty Kiss]], alongside [[Tsushima Yoshiko]] and [[Ohara Mari]].

She has [[yellow eyes]] and [[long hair|long]], [[red hair]], styled as a [[half updo]] with two [[hairclip]]s.

Voiced by [[Aida Rikako]].

title: watanabe_you
body:
[i][[Love Live! Sunshine!!]][/i] character. An energetic student at Uranohoshi High who loves diving and sailing, often depicted in a [[competition swimsuit]] or other swimwear. Enjoys [[salute|saluting]] and using her catchphrase, "Yousoro!"

You is a member of the Aqours sub-unit [[cyaron! (love live!)|CYaRon!]], alongside [[Takami Chika]] and [[Kurosawa Ruby]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] or [[grey hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. A childhood friend of [[Takami Chika]]. 

Voiced by [[Saitou Shuka]].

title: makai_senki_disgaea_7
body:
The seventh entry in the [[Disgaea]] franchise. The demonic realm of Hinomoto is changing and the days of noble warriors are numbered. Caught up in the commotion, the lazy samurai Fuji and bushido fangirl Pirilika find unlikely allies in each other as they fight against a tyrannical regime while discovering the meaning of honor and redemption!

Also known as [b]Disgaea 7: Vows of the Virtueless[/b] in the US

h4.Characters

* [[Ao (disgaea)|]]

* [[Fuji (disgaea)|]]
* [[Higan Zesshousai]]
* [[Pirilika (disgaea)|]]
* [[Suisen (disgaea)|]]
* [[Edogawa yeyasu]]
other_names: 魔界戦記ディスガイア7

title: list_of_nippon_ichi_characters

Various characters reappear in multiple games, but characters will only be listed by their debut game. The games are sorted in chronological order, then the characters alphabetically. title: edogawa_yeyasu
body: [[Makai Senki Disgaea 7]] character. He is supposed to be the Hinomoto Netherworld's shogun, but it is only a hollow title for him when the story begins. He runs around as a shameless womanizer and coward, but is forced to join the party and confront his inner turmoils.

title: daijuuji_kuzaku
body: [[Demonbane]] character. The half-book, half human son of [[Daijuuji Kurou]] and [[Al Azif (demonbane)|]], and the brother and alternate universe counterpart of [[Another Blood]]. He pilots [[Demonbane Two Sword]].

title: daijuuji_kurou
body:
Protagonist of [[Demonbane]].

A financially poor detective and a former magic student at the Miskatonic University, Kurou is one day hired by the Hadou Financial Group to retrieve a powerful grimoire. In his search, he encounters the grimoire [[Al Azif (demonbane)|]], who bestows her power for him to utilize, becoming a magius, in order to fight members of the secretive Black Lodge. Although not a natural warrior, his strong sense of justice and morality allows him to effectively wield Al Azif's power and pilot the Deus Machina, [[Demonbane (mecha)|]].

title: another_blood
body: [[Demonbane]] character. Blood edition of the Necronomicon. The half-book, half human daughter of [[Daijuuji Kurou]] and [[Al Azif (demonbane)|]], and the sister and alternate universe counterpart of [[Daijuuji Kuzaku]].

title: al_azif_(demonbane)
body: [[Demonbane]] character. The original copy of the [[Necronomicon]], and likely the most powerful Grimoire when complete, usually takes the form of a young girl with lavendar hair and a white Gothic Lolita-style dress; she makes a pact with Kurou that allows him access to her power. Normally direct, bold and upbeat with a hint of surliness, she's also impatient with those who are slow to act in danger, yet also realizes when she or Kurou are outclassed. She sometimes refers to herself as [[daijuuji kurou|Kurou]]'s 'property' to tease him in front of others.

title: beavis
body: Beavis is a fictional character who serves as one of two protagonists from the MTV/Paramount+ animated series [[Beavis and Butt-Head]]. He is voiced by the show's creator, Mike Judge. In the movie Beavis and [[Butt-Head]] Do the Universe, Beavis' mother is referred to as "Shirley Beavis", implying that Beavis is actually the character's last name.

title: butt-head
body: Butt-Head is a fictional character and one of the two protagonists from the MTV/Paramount+ animated series [[Beavis and Butt-Head]]. He is voiced by the show's creator, Mike Judge.

title: theneedledrop
body: The [[YouTube]] channel of [[Anthony Fantano]].

title: anthony_fantano
body: Anthony Nicholas Fantano (/fænˈtænoʊ/ fan-TAN-oh; born October 28, 1985) is an American music critic and internet personality who runs [[TheNeedleDrop]], a [[YouTube]] channel with a tie-in website and Twitch streaming channel. Self-appointed as "The Internet's Busiest Music Nerd", Fantano discusses and reviews music from a variety of genres online. He has a presence on X (formerly [[Twitter]]), where he discusses [[music]].

title: legend_of_mortal
body:
Legend of Mortal is an RPG published by Taiwanese developer Obb Studio and Chinese publisher Paras Games and first released on June 2024.

Player plays as [[Zhao Huo]], a third-rate disciple of the Tang-Man sect. As the world is in a turbulent sate, the player must choose his own destiny, to keep himself out of conflict or fight for the future of Tang-Man.

title: spike_(my_little_pony)
body:
Spike is a young dragon and a secondary character in [[My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic]]. He is [[Twilight Sparkle]]'s assistant and also a direct means of communication with [[Princess celestia|Princess Celestia]]. He can send letters instantly to Celestia by disintegrating them with his flame breath and receives letters from her by belching them out with his flames.

In terms of personality, he tries to act boyish and tough, but usually falls flat in his attempts. He's a bit of a glutton, he views Twilight as being like a surrogate mother to him, and he has a not-very-secret crush on [[Rarity (my little pony)|]].

title: byalant_custom
body:
A fictional military manned robot from the [[Gundam]]  [[mecha]] verse. It first appeared in [[Gundam Unicorn]].

[b]RX-160S Byarlant Custom[/b]

An [[Earth Federation]] highly modified, modernized version of the aerospace combat [[Byalant]] [[mobile_suit|MS]], incorporating multiple elements from various [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] designs. Commanded by a veteran MS ace pilot who fought with the Titans, the unit devastated the invading "Sleeves" [[Neo Zeon]] forces at the Battle of Torrington.

[[El Chavo]]'s favorite food.

title: el_chavo
body:
[b]El Chavo[/b] ([i]"The Kid"[/i]) is the main character of the [[mexico|Mexican]] live action TV comedy show [[El Chavo del Ocho]] ([i]"The Kid From The Eight"[/i]).

A kid with [[freckles]] who wears a green [[beanie]] [[hat]] with earflaps. He loves [[ham]] [[torta]]s and lives inside a [[barrel]].

Played by the same actor who plays [[El Chapulin Colorado]], "Roberto Gómez Bolaños, a.k.a. Chespirito":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chespirito .

title: queen_chrysalis
body:
Major [[My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic]] villain. She is the queen of the Changelings, a race of pony-like creatures with shapeshifting abilities who feed off love.

While the Changelings as a group are eventually reformed thanks to [[Thorax (my little pony)|]], Chrysalis rejects them and plots to regain control of her people.

title: transformers_armada
body:
The first [[Transformers]] series in the [[transformers unicron trilogy|Unicron Trilogy]]. It introduced the concept of [[minicon|minicons]] to the franchise and was followed by [i][[Transformers Energon]][/i].

The Japanese title is [i]Transformers Micron Densetsu[/i].


In 2023, Armada reaches its 20th Anniversary. In Transformers Legacy (toyline), Armada is known to be Armada Universe (アルマダユニバース in Japan) and still a part of Unicron Trilogy.

title: transformers_energon
body:
The second [[Transformers]] series in the [[transformers unicron trilogy|Unicron Trilogy]]. It is often considered one of the worst entries in the franchise by fans due to it's poor usage of CGI, bland characterizations, and toys hampered by gimmicks. It was preceded by [i][[Transformers Armada]][/i] and followed by [i][[Transformers Cybertron]][/i].

The Japanese title is [i]Transformers Superlink[/i].

title: transformers_cybertron
body:
The third [[Transformers]] series in the [[transformers unicron trilogy|Unicron Trilogy]]. It was preceded by [i][[Transformers Energon]][/i]. Due to the poor reception of it's predecessor, the show was originally made as a reboot in Japan, although the English dub added in cameos from the previous series' casts to continue with the original plan of the series being a continuation. It was later retconned into the Japanese version of the continuity in supplementary materials.

The Japanese title is [i]Transformers Galaxy Force[/i].
other_names: ギャラクシーフォース

title: oasis_(band)
body:
An English rock band that started in 1991 by the Gallagher brothers, Liam and his older brother Noel(vocalists), Paul "Bonehead" Arthurs(guitar), Paul "Guigsy" McGuigan(Bass guitar) and Tony McCarroll(drums). Often regarded as pioneers of the "Britpop" music scene. The band broke up in 2009 due to increasing animosity between the Gallagher brothers. Since the band's dissolution, Liam formed his owned Rock band called "Beady Eye" while Noel also form his own Rock band called "Noel Gallagher's High Flying Birds".

In August 2024, it was announced the Gallagher brothers have reconcile and reform Oasis and will begin a new 2025 concert Tour in the UK and Ireland.

title: ars_goetia
body:
The Ars Goetia, otherwise known as the Lemegton or The Lesser Key of Solomon, is a 17th-century grimoire describing 72 demons that Solomon is said to have evoked and confined within brass seals. All of them are given ranks, alignments, abilities, characteristics, and specific summoning instructions.

Examples in modern media are the Great Demons [[Gaap (umineko)|]], [[Ronove (umineko)|]], [[Furfur]] and [[Zepar]] in [[Umineko no Naku Koro Ni]].

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: The Lesser Key of Solomon":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Lesser_Key_of_Solomon]

title: dragon_ball:_sparking!
body:
[[Dragon Ball]] fighting game series, debuting on the PlayStation 2 in 2005. In English, the games were referred to as the [i]Budokai Tenkaichi[/i] series, building off of the localized title for the otherwise-unrelated [i]Budokai[/i] series of Dragon Ball fighting games (known in Japanese as just the [i]Dragon Ball Z[/i] fighting game series). The [[Dragon Ball Xenoverse]] games served as spiritual successors to the series (after [i]Burst Limit[/i] and the [i]Raging Blast[/i] series), until its return in 2024 with Dragon Ball: Sparking! Zero.

Alongside featuring playable recreations of the events of [[Dragon Ball Z]], its movies, [[Dragon Ball GT|GT]], and [[Dragon Ball Super|Super]], each game features unique playable 'what if' events.

title: klavier_gavin
body:
[[Kristoph Gavin]]'s younger brother and [[Apollo Justice]]'s rival. Klavier is a prosecuting attorney who learned his trade at age 17 in Europe, and is interested in Apollo because [spoiler]he got his famous brother tried for murder.[/spoiler]

He has [[dark-skinned male|dark skin]], [[blue eyes]] and [[medium hair|medium]] [[blonde hair]] which is usually styled into a [[twisted hair|twist]] worn [[hair over shoulder|over his shoulder]].

He usually wears a [[single earring|single]] [[earrings|earring]] a [[chain necklace|chain]] [[necklace]] featuring his band's logo,, an [[open jacket|open]] [[purple jacket|purple]] [[jacket]] with [[long sleeves]] and [[lapels]], a [[black shirt|black]] [[shirt]] with an [[open collar|open]] [[popped collar|popped]] [[collared shirt|collar]] (that he wears in such a way that exposes a bit of his [[midriff peek|stomach]]), a set of [[multiple rings|rin]][[ring|gs]] on his fingers (including a [[thumb ring]]), a [[belt chain]] and a [[chain belt|chain]] [[belt]], a pair of [[black pants|black]] [[pants]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[cross-laced footwear|cross-laced]] [[shoes]].

When he was seventeen, his hair was [[short hair|short]], and he wore [[sunglasses]], a black shirt with [[buttons]], a [[print shirt|print]] and [[sleeve cuffs]], a pair of black pants with [[pocket]]s and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[lace-up boots|lace-up]] [[boots]].

[b]Japanese Name:[/b] Garyuu Kyouya

title: apollo_justice
body:
The player character of [i]Apollo Justice: [[Ace Attorney]][/i], he is a novice defense attorney initially under [[Kristoph Gavin]]'s mentorship. Afterwards, Apollo meets a hoodlum [[Phoenix Wright]] and his adopted daughter [[Trucy Wright|Trucy]] and starts a makeshift attorney's office with Trucy. He returns in [i][[Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney - Dual Destinies]][/i] wearing bandages and a jacket over his shoulders, and is more mature-looking than before.

Apollo has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] with [[antenna hair|antennae locks]] on top, [[forked eyebrows]], and [[brown eyes]]. 

He usually wears a [[red vest|red]] [[vest]] with [[buttons]], [[lapels]] and [[pockets]]; a [[lapel pin]], a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[shirt]] with [[sleeves rolled up]], a [[bracelet]], an [[aqua necktie|aqua]] or [[blue necktie|blue]] [[necktie]], a [[black belt|black]] [[belt]], a pair of [[red pants|red]] [[pants]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[shoes]].

[b]Japanese Name:[/b] Odoroki Housuke

title: beavis_and_butt-head
body: Beavis and Butt-Head is an American adult animated sitcom created by Mike Judge. The series follows [[Beavis]] and [[Butt-Head]], both voiced by Judge, a pair of teenage slackers characterized by their apathy, lack of intelligence, lowbrow humor, and love for hard rock and heavy metal. The original series juxtaposes slice-of-life short subjects—in which the teens embark on low-minded misadventures in their Texas town—with the pair watching and commenting on music videos.

title: monterrey
body: Monterrey is the capital and largest city of the northeastern state of Nuevo León, [[Mexico]], and the ninth largest city and second largest metro area in Mexico behind Greater [[Mexico City]]. Located at the foothills of the Sierra Madre Oriental, Monterrey is a major North American business and industrial hub, as well as the most populous city in Northern Mexico.

"Okyuu" is a [[pun]] for "Okuu" and "[i]kyuukan-chou[/i] (the Common Hill Myna)."

title: super_yamato
body:
A planned class of battleships of the [[Imperial Japanese Navy]], developing during the [[world war ii|Second World War]]. Generally referred to by its plan number of A-150 in English, in Japanese they are popularly referred to as the [b]Super Yamato-class[/b] battleships. The war would end before a ship could begin formal construction, and to maintain its secrecy, many details on its design were destroyed.

As a result of the loss of significant formal information on the Super Yamato, much speculation exists on the exact specifications of the battleship, though what information exists has led speculation on it contending for the title of the "most powerful battleships in history" if built, such as its main battery of six 45-caliber 51cm guns in three twin turrets, dwarfing the [[Yamato (battleship)|]]-class' 46cm guns. In turn, due to the Yamato-class consisting of the largest battleships ever commissioned, it is generally believed that the Super Yamato-class battleships would have been even larger.

Despite only existing in concept, the Super Yamato has made appearances in media. [[World of Warships]] features the design in three ships currently in the game: the Izumo (an early A-150s design), Shikishima (initially called the Yashima, and is unrelated to the Shikishima-class battleship), and Satsuma (a further development of the A-150 design). It makes an appearance in [[Ryuu ga Gotoku 6|Yakuza 6]] as [spoiler]the "Secret of Onomichi", the project not being scrapped and it continuing production using embezzled money, with the English translation naming it the "Yamato Mark II"[/spoiler]. She appears in [[Warship Girls R]] with the name [[A150 (warship girls r)|]], with her enemy counterpart baring the name [[enemy a150 (warship girls r)|Cyou-yamato]]. Some appearances utilize the names theorized by journalist Itou Masanori, being "Kii" (紀伊) or "Owari" (尾張), potentially inheriting the name(s) of the similarly-planned Kii-class battleships (though this is speculation entirely based on battleship naming conventions) - an example can be found with Fujimi's model ships, releasing the 'phantom battleship' Kii.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Design A-150 battleship":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Design_A-150_battleship

title: scarlet_police
body:
Several Touhou songs by [[IOSYS]], covering [[Remilia Scarlet]] deciding to act as a police officer in Gensokyo. 

"Scarlet Police on Ghetto Patrol 24/7":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7h7bnYA1LXE] is the first song, and is the most popular. It features Remilia and [[Cirno]] engaged in a rap and dance battle, and is the origin of the Funky meme. 
* !post #5366740
"Electricity has stopped! At Scarlet Call":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xcGd_NZaZKw] is the second song, and features the Scarlet Police working an emergency line. 

The Scarlet Police outfits worn by Remilia, Sakuya, and Patchouli have become common themes wherever a police officer is needed. Cirno's first part in Ghetto Patrol has also become a popular meme for the character.

title: fish_mint_(plant)
body:
[b][i]Houttuynia cordata[/i][/b] is a [[flower]]ing plant native to moist and shady regions of Southeast Asia. The plant has many common names, some of which are: [b]chameleon plant[/b], [b]Chinese lizard tail[/b], [b]fish leaf[/b], [b]fish mint[/b], [b]fish wort[/b], [b]heart leaf[/b], and [b]rainbow plant[/b].

The flowers have four to six petals with a tall spike in the center, although the "petals" are actually bracts (petal-like leaves) and the true flowers grow on the spike. The leaves are cordate (heart-shaped).

Houttuynia is used in cooking and medicine throughout Asia. The leaves have a fishy smell and taste, earning the plant one of its common names, fish mint.

h4. Examples
* !asset #23491789: Photo reference
* !post #3192706
* !post #6087096

h4. See also

title: taur
body:

h4. Common Types:
* [[centaur]], humanoid torso on horse body
* [[arachne]], female humanoid torso on spider body
* certain depictions of [[sphinx]]es
* certain depictions of [[arthropod girl]]s and [[arthropod boy|boy]]s
* [[centauroid]], umbrella tag for centaur-like animals that are not horses (goats, deers, etc)

h4. Examples of uncommon types that still qualify for this tag
* !post #1004239: mecha taur 
* !post #4021268: golem taur
* !post #4405129: whale taur (note that the lower body is a complete whale body, unlike most mermaids)

title: ecclesia_(yu-gi-oh!)
body:
A [[duel monster]] from [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] Ecclesia is one of the protagonists of the Abyss Storyline alongside [[Albaz (yu-gi-oh!)|]]. Looks up to [[Fleurdelis (yu-gi-oh!)|]] as her idol. She wields a large [[war hammer]] in combat. Her hairstyle changes over the course of the story to show her development.

One of her defining characteristics is that she's the [[glutton|type to eat big meals]]. With a popular running gag within the Yu-Gi-Oh! fanbase revolves around her trying to eat anything that remotely looks like a food, including other duel monsters. This has reached the point that a Pixiv tag "ごはんはたくさんたべるタイプ" ("a type to eat big meals") was dedicated to her. 

This tag has become so memetic, the concept artist for Live Twin Lil-la Treat references it in a conversation between [[lil-la_(yu-gi-oh!)|Lil-la]] and [[ki-sikil_(yu-gi-oh!)|Ki-sikil]].

h4. Variants
* [[Dogmatika Ecclesia the Virtuous]] - The original, wears [[armor]], has a [[war hammer]] 
* [[Incredible Ecclesia the Virtuous]] - [[Ponytail]], [[goggles]], [[suspender shorts]], [[sleeveless shirt]], a [[skull]] [[war hammer]]
* [[Blazing Cartesia the Virtuous]]
* [[New Frontier (yu-gi-oh!)|]]
* [[Ecclesia the Exiled]]
other_names: ごはんはたくさんたべるタイプ

title: inaba_tewi
body:
The "Earth-Rabbit", Stage 5 midboss of [[Touhou]]'s [i][[Imperishable Night]][/i], and later a playable character in [i][[Phantasmagoria of Flower View]][/i]. A [[rabbit girl|rabbit]] youkai with the power to bring good fortune to humans, often leading them out of or through the [[bamboo forest]] and into [[Eientei]], where she also serves as de facto leader of the [[inaba mob (touhou)|earth-rabbits]]. Known for her playful and at times mischievous personality.

She is occasionally depicted wielding a [[kine]] mallet, normally used to pound rice into [[mochi]].

Possibly the [[Hare of Inaba]] from the ancient Kojiki, the oldest book of Japan's written legends. This would make her one of the oldest living beings in Gensokyo.

h4. Appearance
* !asset #23489643

She has [[short hair|short]] [[black hair|black]] or [[brown hair]] that is often [[wavy hair|wavy]], [[red eyes]], and [[floppy ears|floppy]] [[rabbit ears]]. Her outfit is a simple [[pink dress]] with [[frilled dress|frills]] and a [[ribbon-trimmed dress|ribbon trim]] on the hem with [[puffy short sleeves|puffy]] [[frilled sleeves]], sometimes with her [[rabbit tail|tail]] out. Her signature accessory is her [[carrot necklace]] and she often goes [[barefoot]].

They make their first clear appearance in [[Touhou Bougetsushou]], in both [[Silent Sinner in Blue]] and [[Inaba of the Moon and Inaba of the Earth]]. In the former, they are depicted in humanoid form, similar to Tewi. In the latter meanwhile, they are depicted in animal form, [[rabbit|bunnies]], with simple features such as ears and arms that are drawn round and short, simple slits for the eyes (although a more round one are also acceptable), and a cat-like curled mouth.

title: manchu_clothes
body: Also known as Qizhuang , lit. 'Banner Dress' - or Manfu, lit. 'Manchu clothes'. Traditional clothing of the Manchu people in China. h4. Examples of Manchu clothing h5. Outfits h6. Paofu (袍服) Any type of traditional robe; all one-piece and long in design. Also known as Pao [tn](袍)[/tn]. * [[Changpao]] (長袍): A robe, worn by men; the Han Chinese changshan is an offshoot of this. * Chenyi (衬衣): A type of dress * Jifu (吉服): Worn for fesitive occasions. Subtypes includes the Jifupao (吉服袍), and the longgua (or jifugua) (吉服褂). h5. Headwear * [[Qitou]] (旗头): A traditional headwear or hairstyle that crests over the crown of the head, with subtypes including the [[liangbatou]] and [[dalachi_(headdress)|]]. h5. Misc. * Matixiu (马蹄袖); lit. 'horseshoe sleeves'; semi-wide sleeves that distinctly taper inwards at the bottom. H4. Footwear * [[Qixie]]

title: propane_tank
body:
A common type of [[gas cylinder]] designed to contain [[flammable symbol|flammable]] gases like LPG (commonly propane and butane) generally intended for domestic/outdoor [[cooking]] and heating fuel. This tag should be used for the "portable propane cylinders":[/posts/1850700] larger than portable stove "fuel canisters":[/posts/4143518], but smaller than the huge fixed [[tank (container)|pill-shaped tanks]] installed outside a building ("example":[https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Berry_Town_Hall%27s_Propane_Tank_-_panoramio.jpg]). 

Propane tanks are identifiable by its stubby shape, the presence of a metal protective collar or neck ring around the valve at the top of the canister, a huge carry handle, and a metal foot ring on the bottom.

h4. Examples
* !post #7491784
* !post #8072244

title: bonbon_(my_little_pony)
body:
A background character in [[My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic]] who has curly pink and dark blue hair, often depicted with [[Lyra Heartstrings]].

In fan works, she is portrayed as being calm and conservative in her actions, and tries to keep Lyra's obsessions from getting out of hand. She has a different voice actress every time she has a speaking role.

In the hundredth episode of the series, she revealed herself to be former secret agent Sweetie Drops, and also seemed to have a very close and affectionate friendship with Lyra. In the background of several episodes it is shown that the two are a couple, with one scene showing them proposing to each other and then a wedding photo appearing in a newspaper.
other_names: ボンボン(マイリトルポニー)

title: lyra_heartstrings
body:
A minty green unicorn who is a background character in [[My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic]]. She is often depicted with [[Bonbon (my little pony)|]].

Fans depict her as having an expressive and hyperactive personality as well as an obsession with humans and hands. In the show, she has been seen jumping and grinning madly while staring at the viewer in many crowd shots, as if trying to get the viewer's attention, and has a tendency to behave in a human-like manner (trying to hold things with her hooves, slouching on a bench instead of laying on her belly.)

She and Bonbon were shown to have a very close and affectionate friendship in the background pony-oriented hundredth episode. In the background of several episodes it is shown that the two are a couple, with one scene showing them proposing to each other and then a wedding photo appearing in a newspaper.
other_names: ライラ・ハートストリングス

title: drag_queen
body:
A performer, usually male, who uses clothing and makeup to exaggerate female gender roles and femininity for the purpose of entertainment or expression. 

Drag makeup and clothing are usually flashy and overly flamboyant, intentionally drawing attention to the wearer. Queens usually perform in drag shows for the entertainment of the audience, usually featuring lip-syncing and dancing.

While the art is traditionally associated with [[crossdressing]], some women (both cis and trans) also participate in the activity. [[Chappell Roan (person)|]] is a good example of a cisgender woman who often dresses in drag in her performances.

h4. See also

* [[RuPaul's Drag Race]]

body:

May be depicted in different ways by different artists and depending on the season: [[Limited Life SMP]] art often depicts it as part of a pocket watch, while in general many artists often depict it as a tattoo on the body or as a literal life meter.

It is also commonly used in a full red-yellow-green "traffic light" design to represent the series as a whole.

h4. See also

* [[Hardcore Heart]]

title: pear_blossom
body: Pear blossom, belonging to the genus Pyrus in the Rosaceae family, refers to the flowers of the pear tree. The pear tree is a deciduous tree with leaves that are round like those of the large-leaved poplar, and its trunk is covered with thick bark, while its branches spread out like an umbrella. It blooms in spring, with flowers that are pure white, resembling snowflakes, and emitting a faint fragrance. Pears can be eaten raw, as well as used for making wine, pear syrup, pear preserves, and for medicinal purposes. The cultivation history of pear blossoms in China spans over 2000 years.

Tank commander of a [[KV-1]] on the "Keizoku High School":[#dtext-see-also] tankery team. She has long brown hair which is made to a [[pompadour]].

Voiced by [[Tada Konomi]] "[1]":[#dtext-external-links].

[expand=Official Character Bio (spoilers)]

h5. Keizoku High School

h6. Das Finale

KV-1 tank commander. Responds to Mika's kantele by playing her accordion. The truth is, she wishes she could freely express herself without going in a roundabout way. Doesn't remember why she chose her haircut, but there must have been a significant reason. Very good at taking off round-necked shirts without disturbing her hairstyle.

[/expand]

title: savanna_striped_giant_slug_(kemono_friends)
body:
Comedic depictions of [i][[Kemono Friends]][/i]' [[plains_zebra_(kemono_friends)|Plains Zebra]] as a giant slug, or of a creature independent from Plains Zebra. The Savanna Striped Giant Slug is a simple-shaped, white slug-like blob with black zebra stripes, its size most typically varying from palm-sized to Friend-sized to horse-sized.

The gag stems from Plains Zebra's cameo in the original anime run, wherein she is seen only from behind, at a distance, and as obscured by tall grass, leaving only her very long, striped hair and ears visible; the resulting silhouette resembles a white, stripey slug-like blob, resulting in fan art of the apparent slug creature and nicknames such as [i]Plains Zebra-striped giant slug[/i] being given to Plains Zebra. It can be seen as a background element in various Kemono Friends fan art works, often hiding in tall grass as per its origins.

Frequently paired with [[jaguar_(kemono_friends)|Jaguar]] in fan art.
other_names: サバンナシマシマオオナメクジ

title: lantern_(e.g.o)
body:
[[E.G.O (Project Moon)|E.G.O]] extracted from the abnormality [[Meat Lantern (project moon)|]] or [[Faelantern (project moon)|]].

This E.G.O is, for now, the only name shared by two abnormalities.
This could be explained by Faelantern being an Aberration, but other Aberrations don't follow this trend. 
For now, at least, they share this tag.

Meat Lantern's E.G.O suit is the standard [[armor|armored]] [[suit]] found in Lobotomy Corporation, made of a fluffy material resembling wool with a green [[light bulb]] in the chest area.
Its weapon looks like a [[mace]] with teeth.

title: toradora!
body:
A 2006-2010 13-volume light novel series by Takemiya Yuyuko, with art by [[Yasu]]. Later adapted into a manga with art by [[Zekkyou_(h9s9)|]], an Internet radio show, a PSP visual novel, and a 2008 anime series by J.C. Staff.

[[Takasu Ryuuji]] and [[Aisaka Taiga]] are students feared throughout their school - Ryuuji, on account of his intimidating appearance (despite being a rather nice guy), and Taiga, on account of her short temper (despite her good looks). One day, they discover that they're neighbors, and have a crush on each other's best friends - Ryuuji to [[Kushieda Minori]] and Taiga to [[Kitamura Yuusaku]]. Both have since made a pact to help each other win their love interests, even as they start to become more than just partners...

body:

Often involves [[female orgasm]] or [[female ejaculation]].
Doesn't have to result in [[stomach bulge]].

h4. Note

The stimulation should not be caused coincidentally by a [[vaginal object insertion]] that also stimulates other parts of the vagina (e.g. the mere presence of a penis, vibrator, hand, etc).

The tag would technically fit posts that show only the outside of the body in a way that implies g-spot stimulation (example: post #8168641), but searching and tagging existing posts would involve a lot of work (>10k posts).

body:

[spoilers] She is in fact [[azazel_(helltaker)|Azazel, the curious angel]], having fallen due to her excessive curiosity. It has served her well however, as she used all the knowledge she had gained to conquer hell in the interim between the events of the main game and Examtaker.[/spoilers]

title: alina_seo
body:
A Gestalt [[Elster (signalis)|]] is searching for throughout Sierpinski. 

[spoiler] Due to her lost memories as LSTR-512 and resurfacing memories of her original [[Lilith Itou (signalis)|Gestalt identity]], Elster believes she's searching for Alina Seo when she's actually searching for [[Ariane Yeong]].

title: ariane_yeong
body:
The Gestalt pilot and officer of [[spacecraft|Penrose-512]]. After their ship crashlands on the frozen planet Leng, her [[Android|Replika]] crewmate [[Elster (signalis)|Elster]] goes in search of her throughout Sierpinski.

[Spoiler] It's eventually revealed that Ariane and [[Elster (signalis)|Elster]] are lovers, and that [[Elster (signalis)|Elster's]] search for Ariane is to fulfil an unknown promise the two of them previously made onboard the Penrose. 

It's additionally revealed that Ariane is Bioresonant, and heavily implied that much (if not all) of the games events and story are caused by her bioresonant abilities.

title: isolde_itou
body:
A Gestalt [[Elster (signalis)|]] repeatedly encounters during the events of the game who is searching for her sister [[Erika Itou (signalis)|]].

[spoiler] Near the climax, it's heavily implied that she and her sister [[Erika Itou (signalis)|]] died before the events of the game, and her existence is due to [[Ariane Yeong]]'s Bioresonant abilities manifesting her into reality.

title: altena_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Altena[/b] ([i]Arutena[/i]) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem: Genealogy of the Holy War]]'s Second Generation. She is the daughter of [[Quan (Fire Emblem)|]] and [[Ethlyn (Fire Emblem)|]] and [[Leif (Fire Emblem)|]]'s older sister, as well as the inheritor of the lance [[Gae Bolg (Fire Emblem)|]].

[spoilers]Following the Aed Massacre, she was abducted by [[Travant (Fire Emblem)|]] as a child and raised as his daughter. She later discovers the truth about her heritage and joins [[Seliph (Fire Emblem)|]]'s army.[/spoilers]

[b]Holy Blood:[/b] Njörun (Major)
